meanings.definition: A federal health insurance program for people who are 65 or older
meanings.sent1: My grandparents rely on Medicare for their health insurance.
meanings.sent2: Many seniors benefit from enrolling in Medicare when they turn 65.
meanings.sent3: When Grandma said she was going to a Medicare party, I thought it was a celebration for insurance!
meanings.sent4: Medicare is like a safety net for older adults, ensuring they have access to healthcare.
meanings.sent5: The word 'Medicare' always reminds me of taking care of my health as I age.

meanings.definition: The government program that provides health insurance to people who are disabled
meanings.sent1: Individuals with disabilities can receive support through Medicare.
meanings.sent2: Medicare offers essential health coverage to those who are unable to work due to disabilities.
meanings.sent3: I joked with my friend that his broken leg might qualify him for Medicare benefits!
meanings.sent4: For those with disabilities, Medicare is like a guardian angel for medical expenses.
meanings.sent5: The concept of Medicare ensures that everyone, regardless of ability, can access healthcare.

meanings.definition: The federal program that provides health insurance to people with end-stage renal disease
meanings.sent1: Patients undergoing dialysis often rely on Medicare for financial assistance.
meanings.sent2: Medicare plays a crucial role in supporting individuals with end-stage renal disease.
meanings.sent3: I told my cousin with a kidney condition that he should look into Medicare for help!
meanings.sent4: To those with end-stage renal disease, Medicare is a lifeline for medical care.
meanings.sent5: The word 'Medicare' symbolizes hope and support for those battling severe kidney issues.
